div.head: To Monsiour du Chesne, Baron and Lord of Morence and Lyserable.
div.l: VNgratefull should I be, and void of nurtures lore▪
If that I should neglect to make report:
Of vertues rare in you that beare such svvay,
As them to knovv may breed each mans comfort.
A Nurse the Muses haue you found, and ye
Proud ignorance haue striken such a blovv,
By your vvritings as learned graue and vvise,
And that your name for euer men shal knovv.
Not onely haue ye hereby done much good,
In shevving vvhatmen chiefly ought to shunne:
But medicines right ye haue set dovvne, and hovv
To cure all such as wounded are by Gunne.
